job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Philadelphia, PA
pros: VNA was good to work but everywhere depends on management. The pay was great.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Omaha, NE
pros: Great place to work, hardworking and professional employees. Management is great. They really do serve the community well. 125 years of helping the community.
cons: CEO. 125 years in the community and he has a multi mega health care agency acquiring hospice and home health. Now no longer a non-profit for those two departments and a name change.

pros: Working for the VNA has allowed me to have a meaningful impact on our community. I work along side some incredible clinical staff
cons: Poor upper management. No room to move up in the organization. Publicly traded to Amedisys and is now a for profit company

pros: Flexible schedule, autonomy, reasonable productivity expectations
cons: Poor referrals at times, too many referrals

pros: Flexible I card for my son
cons: Hard work when working in nursing home

pros:

pros: The work is rewarding, you truly make a difference every day.
cons: The pay is not competitive, the benefits are among the worst I have ever heard of, FMLA is unpaid, you work out in good or bad weather without our any type of hazard pay, lots of wear and tear on your personal care. The cases you work with are indeed in need of your help but it’s hard to leave you work at the office.

pros: good culture, feels like community. sense of purpose with work to reach out and be the best at providing wide range of home care services  often to those on the marginal end.  management tries hard to provide reasonable compensation but struggle due to non profit status
cons: no benefits for continuing education.  work tends to eclipse rest of life. hard to make clean break from work it always follows you.

review_title: Expect minimum of 10-15 hours extra work every week.
pros: I love the patients and the work itself is great.
cons: Too much work to complete in 40 hours per week.  Horrible benefits.  Compensation plan is confusing and not beneficial to employees compared to the promises of salary and compensation that are promised before you start.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Omaha, NE
pros: The patients make the job tolerable!
cons: Zero work/life balance; always expecting more productivity; documentation and travel take up a lot of time
